p: The 65–74 and ≥75 years age groups were associated with an increased risk of death (aOR 2.46, 95% CI: 1.22–4.97 and 2.13, 95% CI: 1.05–4.30, respectively). Immune deficiency, chronic cardiovascular disease and chronic liver disease were also associated with an increased risk of death. Antiviral treatment administered ≤48 hours before symptom onset was associated with a lower risk of death ( Fig 2 and S2 Table).
